posts.post_content: This guy is a house- it's rather shocking how under valued he is compared to some of the flashier planeswalkers, but I think this guy is the best of them all, by virtue of practicality and low casting cost.

Posted By: Smoked_Peasant (1/1/2009 2:32:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I absolutely adore the artwork on this, and certainly more than that for the [Walletslayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=195297). He kills that Planeswalker stone dead, and makes for a great drawing engine. His [+2 ability](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205058) helps keep him on the battlefield, and with [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx) now around, it allows you to draw 3 cards while adding loyalty counters to Jace. Excellent!
posts.html:
I absolutely adore the artwork on this, and certainly more than that for the Walletslayer. He kills that Planeswalker stone dead, and makes for a great drawing engine. His +2 ability helps keep him on the battlefield, and with Consecrated Sphinx now around, it allows you to draw 3 cards while adding loyalty counters to Jace. Excellent!
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Kodanshi (3/27/2011 12:15:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I used him in my UW deck (which I disas$embled a few minutes ago) and as long as I kept his loyalty below 4 everyone I played with didn't seem to mind him being on the field. That makes him the only planeswalker of the four that I have that didn't become top priority for my oponents to kill. Using him as a drawing engine is ouright useful, and other players don't really see him as much of a threat (as long as you keep his counters low) so he sticks around to help you out longer then most planeswalkers. I think Jace is my favorite planeswalker.
posts.html:

I think Jace is my favorite planeswalker.

Posted By: Eved (12/21/2009 9:20:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Jace is very good, although he might not seem like much compared to other Planeswalkers. What I REALLY love about him, though, is the illustration. His design is astonishing, so menacing... He just radiates power. A frightening power, I might add. The barren background also plays a role here. In my eyes, other Planeswalkers look more like mere legends when compared to him. I consider Jace to be one of the characters with the best design, not just in Magic, but in general.  
  
Oh, and take a look at THIS:  
  
http://www.coolstuffinc.com/images/Products/mtg%20art/Promo/book-jace-beleren.jpg  
  
That's just epic. Kudos to Aleksi Briclot.

Posted By: True_Mumin (6/17/2009 6:51:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like this guy. At worst, he's a [Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), and at best he's a [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena). I don't think you'll use his final ability that much unless you have a milling deck, but his first two abilities are reason enough to play him.
  
   
Jace's one drawback is that he has no way to defend himself. You'll find that he takes a lot of damage because can't spit out tokens every turn to block for him like Elsepth and Garruk do.
posts.html:
I really like this guy. At worst, he's a Howling Mine, and at best he's a Phyrexian Arena. I don't think you'll use his final ability that much unless you have a milling deck, but his first two abilities are reason enough to play him.

Jace's one drawback is that he has no way to defend himself. You'll find that he takes a lot of damage because can't spit out tokens every turn to block for him like Elsepth and Garruk do.

Jace is great, I love him (although the alternative art looks better) but I wish his -1 ability was counter target card, but then his ability would be instant speed, hmm, you know, I think I would be happy if his cost was 2UUU and he used his -1 to counter at instant
  
it feels more blue to be countering then milling, although my mill deck is mono blue ;)
